Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warriors (on left, helmet with traces of added red and crest, part of round shield with added white dots and shoulder of fallen warrior; of second warrior, part of red chiton with white dots on hem, greaved legs and round shield with whirligig pattern on device remain); both face left; at right, probably part of panel border.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 38, no. 14, pl. XIX, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.101) (phase 3)
